dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has the Utmost Confidence In -- He's Been a Buyer for 24 of the Last 25 Quarters
News Content: When Berkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) CEO Warren Buffett speaks, investors wisely pay attention. That's because the appropriately dubbed "Oracle of Omaha" has overseen a cumulative return in his company's Class A shares (BRK.A) of more than 5,570,000% spanning six decades.

Buffett's keys to success are no secret. Whether it's in his annual letter to shareholders or during the question-and-answer session at Berkshire's annual meeting, he lays out his game plan to for building wealth on Wall Street and keeping emotions in check. Berkshire's chief is a value-oriented, long-term investor who primarily focuses on businesses with sustainable competitive advantages and strong management teams.

But when overseeing a 44-stock, $296 billion investment portfolio, it can be tough to tell which, if any, stocks the Oracle of Omaha has the most confidence in.Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett. Image source: The Motley Fool.

Apple, AmEx, and Bank of America are large holdings -- but none are Buffett's favorite stock

Logic would dictate that the three largest holdings by market value in Berkshire Hathaway's investment portfolio are the company's Warren Buffett has the utmost confidence in... but this isn't necessarily the case.

Tech giant Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) has consistently been Berkshire's top holding for years, and remains a company Buffett speaks highly about. Aside from the iPhone being the market share-leading smartphone in the U.S., Apple's capital-return program is world-leading. More than $725 billion worth of the company's stock has been repurchased since the start of 2013, which has demonstrably improved its earnings per share (EPS).

However, Buffett and his top advisors, Todd Combs and Ted Weschler, have also overseen the sale of more than 615 million shares of Apple stock between Oct. 1, 2023 and Sept. 30, 2024. Even if this selling is purely for tax purposes, it likely rules out Apple as the stock Buffett has the most confidence in.

Credit-services provider American Express(NYSE: AXP) has worked its way up to No. 2 spot in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. "AmEx," as American Express is more commonly known, was labeled an "indefinite" holding in Buffett's letter to shareholders last year. Berkshire's investment team likely appreciate AmEx's ability to play both sides of the transaction counter, with the company generating payment processing fees from merchants, as well as annual fees and interest income from cardholders.

Yet it's been a long time since Buffett purchased shares of American Express. If this were truly Buffett's favorite company, he would likely add to the position.

Story Continues

Berkshire Hathaway's third-largest holding, Bank of America(NYSE: BAC), is a similar story to Apple. It's a company whose management team has received praise in the past from Buffett. BofA is the most interest-sensitive of America's money-center banks and it benefited immensely from the Federal Reserve's aggressive rate-hiking cycle from March 2022 through July 2023.

But since July 17, 2024, required Form 4 filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) show that Berkshire's top investment minds (led by Buffett) have sold 26% (about 266.5 million shares) of their Bank of America stake.Image source: Getty Images.

The Oracle of Omaha has purchased this stock in 24 out of the last 25 quarters

Interestingly enough, the stock Warren Buffett appears to have the utmost confidence in is a company that doesn't show up in Berkshire's quarterly filed Form 13Fs with the SEC. This is the form investors use to track the purchase and selling activity at Buffett's company.

Rather, detailed purchasing activity of this "favorite stock" can be found in Berkshire Hathaway's quarterly operating results. On the page prior to the beginning of the executive certifications, investors will find a breakdown of how many shares of Berkshire Hathaway Class A and B (BRK.B) stock the Oracle of Omaha purchased during the quarter. Perhaps it's fitting that the stock Buffett buys most and has the utmost confidence in is shares of his own company.

However, buying shares of Berkshire Hathaway stock hasn't always been easy for Warren Buffett. Prior to July 2018, shares could only be repurchased if Berkshire's stock fell to or below 120% of book value. Unfortunately (for Buffett), this is a threshold Berkshire Hathaway's stock never dipped to or below, which led to no buyback activity.

On July 17, 2018, Berkshire's board reworked the rules governing buybacks to give its CEO more freedom to buy shares of the company he's clearly the most confident in. Under the new criteria, share repurchases have no end date or cap as long as Berkshire has at least $30 billion in combined cash, cash equivalents, and U.S. Treasuries, and Buffett views his company's stock as intrinsically cheap. This last part is intentionally vague and allows Buffett to deploy his company's capital toward buybacks as he sees fit.

Even though Buffett didn't repurchase shares of his company's stock in the September-ended quarter, he had done so in each of the previous 24 quarters, with a cumulative $78 billion spent on buybacks.

Aside from these repurchases reinforcing Buffett's belief that Berkshire Hathaway is ideally positioned to take advantage of lengthy periods of economic expansion, these buybacks serve two additional purposes.

For one, steadily reducing the company's outstanding share count is incrementally increasing the ownership stakes of Berkshire's investors. This goes a long way to incentivizing the long-term ethos that Buffett's late right-hand man, Charlie Munger, helped to instill.

The other purpose behind these buybacks is to make Berkshire's stock more fundamentally attractive. Companies with steady or growing net income and a declining outstanding share count can expect their EPS to increase over time.

With Berkshire Hathaway closing out the third quarter with a record $325.2 billion in (combined) cash, cash equivalents, and U.S. Treasuries on its balance sheet, it seems only logical to expect Buffett to buy shares of the stock nearest and dearest to his heart in 2025.

Don’t miss this second chance at a potentially lucrative opportunity

Ever feel like you missed the boat in buying the most successful stocks? Then you’ll want to hear this.

On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a “Double Down” stock recommendation for companies that they think are about to pop. If you’re worried you’ve already missed your chance to invest, now is the best time to buy before it’s too late. And the numbers speak for themselves:

Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $369,816!* Apple: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2008, you’d have $42,191!* Netflix: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, you’d have $527,206!*

Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon.

Learn more »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 21, 2025

Bank of America and American Express are advertising partners of Motley Fool Money. Sean Williams has positions in Bank of America. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has the Utmost Confidence In -- He's Been a Buyer for 24 of the Last 25 Quarters was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's long-term confidence in Apple Inc. as a significant holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. Despite recent share sales, the overall sentiment remains positive due to Apple's strong market position and capital-return program. The mention of Buffett's consistent buybacks of Berkshire stock suggests a broader confidence in the market, which could positively influence investor sentiment towards Apple. However, the recent share sales may create some uncertainty. Overall, the positive sentiment outweighs the negative, leading to a higher probability of stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article primarily focuses on Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A/BRK.B) and its relationship with Apple (AAPL). While Apple's earnings report on January 30th is mentioned, the article suggests that Berkshire Hathaway's stock price is unlikely to be significantly affected by Apple's results. The historical data provided shows a moderate correlation between the two stocks, but past instances of strong Apple earnings reports did not lead to substantial gains for Berkshire Hathaway. Furthermore, the article points out that Berkshire Hathaway's valuation is currently high, and the company has not been buying back its own shares, suggesting that even Warren Buffett may not see it as a particularly attractive investment at the moment. The article concludes that there's no compelling reason to rush into buying Berkshire Hathaway stock before Apple's earnings report. Therefore, the news is slightly negative for Berkshire Hathaway, and neutral for Apple. Since the article is about Berkshire Hathaway, the prediction is about Berkshire Hathaway.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news article describes a temporary frenzy surrounding iPhones with TikTok pre-installed due to a brief ban and subsequent reinstatement of the app. While the high prices fetched for these phones on eBay highlight the strong user engagement with TikTok, this event is unlikely to have a significant long-term impact on Apple's stock price. The issue is isolated to a short-lived situation and doesn't reflect on Apple's core business performance or future prospects.  The exorbitant prices are driven by scarcity and speculation, not by any fundamental change in Apple's market position or product demand.  Therefore, the probability of a stock price rise or fall due to this news is very low.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news headline discusses how major tech companies, including Apple, are framing their AI narratives in earnings calls. Apple's involvement in AI is a positive signal, as the company is known for its innovative technologies and strong market position. While the news itself is neutral, it highlights Apple's engagement with AI, which could be perceived positively by investors, potentially leading to a slight increase in stock price. However, without specific financial data or product announcements, the impact is likely to be modest.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's current position in the AI landscape and an analyst's opinion that AI is not a strong enough driver to take Apple to the next level. The analyst, Bonawyn Eison, expresses skepticism about AI being a catalyst for Apple's growth, citing the company's fully valued status and the need for new catalysts. Additionally, Apple's recent financial performance, including an 8% decline in revenue in China, and weak performance in the Wearables, Home, and Accessories segment, contribute to a negative outlook. The article also mentions that Apple's high valuation and lack of promising growth prospects, such as the iPhone 16 and Vision Pro, may lead to a wait-and-see approach from investors. Overall, the analyst's comments and the company's current challenges suggest a higher likelihood of the stock price falling rather than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple Inc. (AAPL) as one of the favorite stocks analyzed by Zacks Market Edge. The article mentions that Apple's shares have declined 11.3% year-to-date and are now only up 15.4% over the last year. Additionally, Apple has a Zacks Rank of 4, or Sell, and a forward P/E ratio of 30.1, which is considered high. However, the article also notes that Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock and one of the four pillars of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway empire, which could indicate a potential for long-term growth. Given this mixed information, I estimate that the probability of the stock price rising is lower than the probability of it falling in the short term, but still possible due to Apple's strong brand and market position.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error

It highlights that Apple is a significant holding in Berkshire's portfolio, but historical data suggests that Apple's earnings don't strongly influence Berkshire's stock price. The article also points out that Berkshire's valuation is currently high, and the company isn't buying back shares, suggesting Buffett doesn't see it as particularly attractive. While the article concludes that Berkshire is a good long-term investment, it doesn't recommend rushing to buy it before Apple's earnings. Considering the mixed signals and the historical data, the impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be neutral. The previous predictions are quite varied, with some leaning towards a rise and others towards a fall. Given the article's focus on Berkshire Hathaway and the limited direct impact on Apple, I'm adjusting my prediction to reflect a more neutral outlook for Apple.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.05, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.05, Reasoning: The news about iPhones with TikTok pre-installed selling for exorbitant prices on eBay is a short-term, anecdotal event driven by a temporary TikTok ban and subsequent reinstatement.  This event is unlikely to have a significant or lasting impact on Apple's stock price. The high prices are a result of artificial scarcity and speculation, not a reflection of increased demand for Apple products or a fundamental shift in Apple's business.  While the event highlights the popularity of TikTok and its user base, it does not translate into a positive or negative indicator for Apple's long-term financial performance.  The previous predictions show a range of opinions, but most agree that the impact of this news is minimal. Therefore, the probability of a stock price movement (either up or down) due to this specific news is very low.

The article also points out that Berkshire's valuation is high and Buffett isn't buying back shares, indicating a lack of immediate upside. The article concludes that there's no reason to rush to invest in Berkshire. The previous predictions are mixed, with some leaning towards a rise and others towards a fall. Considering the article's focus on Berkshire Hathaway and the limited direct impact on Apple, I'm predicting the stock price movement for Apple. The article mentions Apple Intelligence and its potential impact on iPhone sales, which could be a positive catalyst. Considering these factors, I believe there's a slightly higher chance of a positive surprise than a negative one, but the overall impact is likely to be moderate.

The event is a short-term anomaly driven by artificial scarcity and speculation, not by any fundamental change in Apple's business or product demand. While it highlights TikTok's popularity, it doesn't reflect on Apple's core strengths or weaknesses.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, but most agree that the impact of this news is minimal. Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news highlights Warren Buffett's long-term confidence in Apple Inc. as a significant holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. Despite recent share sales, the overall sentiment remains positive due to Apple's strong market position and capital-return program. The consistent buybacks of Berkshire stock suggest broader market confidence, which could positively influence investor sentiment towards Apple. However, the recent share sales may create some uncertainty. Overall, the positive sentiment outweighs the negative, leading to a higher probability of stock price rise.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has the Utmost Confidence In -- He's Been a Buyer for 24 of the Last 25 Quarters",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.65,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.35
}
```
